result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin F Kidd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by DOC. To be paid during period of Extended Supervision or civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victim Kimberly S. during Initial Confinement  and Extended Supervision.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continue programming.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Calvin F Kidd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Calvin F Kidd in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Calvin F Kidd in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Presentence report reviewed.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Dawn S. 

AS TO COUNT #2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE to case 2014CF4787),  with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; THE MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Kimberly S. 
  during initial confinement and extended supervision.    
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank 
   and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Memorandum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.  mld

with the clerk and Attorney Anna Marie Wineke to reschedule Sentencing Hearing, due to the unavailability of defense counsel from 3-23-2015 at 8:30 am to 5-22-2015 at 8:30 am.  ADA Nicolas Heitman was present in the courtroom and advised of the adjourned date for the Sentencing Hearing.   mld
Presentence Investigation Report, received and filed.  mld

Defendant Calvin F Kidd in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Calvin F Kidd in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion fo the State, Court ordered COUNT #1, dismissed and read-in for the purposes sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #2:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 3-23-2015 at 8:30 am.  PSI w/o recommendation.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.  mld

Defendant Calvin F Kidd in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Calvin F Kidd in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.   Parties have a joint resolution for the old and new case.  Defendant to enter a plea.  Court vacates the Preliminary Hearing, scheduled in branch 4 on 2-2-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KIMBERLY S.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Calvin F Kidd
Current: 5511 N 33RD ST, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 01-24-2015)
Prior: 3611 North 76th Street #4, Milwaukee, WI 53222

Defendant Calvin F Kidd in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Calvin F Kidd in custody.  William Nathaniel Gale Barron appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
